Package server

Class Communication

java.lang.Object
server.Communication
public class Communication extends Object
Facilitates communication over the network with strings and maps.

All command-generation methods follow some general rules:

  • A null value is returned if any Object argument is null.

  • Method Details

    • cmdMove

      public static Map<String,String> cmdMove(boolean up, boolean left, boolean down, boolean right, double rad)
      Generates the payload for a movement command.

      This command is comprised of the following components:

      color Command Payload
      Key Commentary
      opcode Identifies this command, always move.
      up Whether the player is attempting to move up, as a stringified boolean.
      left Whether the player is attempting to move left, as a stringified boolean.
      down Whether the player is attempting to move down, as a stringified boolean.
      left Whether the player is attempting to move right, as a stringified boolean.
      rad The rotation, in radians on the unit circle, of the player.
      Parameters:
      up - whether the player is moving up.
      left - whether the player is moving left.
      down - whether the player is moving down.
      right - whether the player is moving right.
      rad - the rotation of the player sprite.
      Returns:
      the command payload.

    • cmdShoot

      public static Map<String,String> cmdShoot()
      Generates the payload for a shoot command. The information for bullet type and direction is taken from the latest move command recieved from the player and the weapon they have equipped.

      This command is comprised of the following components:

      color Command Payload
      Key Commentary
      opcode Identifies this command, always shoot.
      Returns:
      the command payload.

    • cmdPosPlayer

      public static Map<String,String> cmdPosPlayer(Player player, int playerId)
      Generates the payload for a player position command.

      This command is comprised of the following components:

      color Command Payload
      Key Commentary
      opcode Identifies this command, always pos_player.
      id The UID of the player.
      x The x position of the player.
      y The y position of the player.
      rad The rotation, in radians on the unit circle, of the player.
      Parameters:
      player - the player object that has moved.
      playerId - the UID of the player.
      Returns:
      the command payload.

    • cmdNewBullet

      public static Map<String,String> cmdNewBullet(Bullet bullet, int bulletId, int playerId)
      Generates the payload for a new bullet command. The information in this command defines the initial conditions of the bullet. From that, it is up to the client to accurately simulate the path of the bullet, although the final decision for collisions is given by the server, not the clients.

      This command is comprised of the following components:

      color Command Payload
      Key Commentary
      opcode Identifies this command, always pos_bullet.
      x The x position of the bullet.
      y The y position of the bullet.
      rad The rotation, in radians on the unit circle, of the bullet.
      bullet_num The number of the bullet in a sequence of multiple bullets fired by the same weapon, starting at 0.
      id The UID of the player that fired the bullet. This can be used by the client to determine the weapon type and other information.
      Parameters:
      bullet - the bullet object that was created.
      bulletId - the number of the bullet in a sequence of multiple bullets fired by the same weapon.
      playerId - the UID of the player that fired the bullet.
      Returns:
      the command payload.

    • cmdJoin

      public static Map<String,String> cmdJoin(int playerId, double x, double y, int levelId)
      Generates the payload for a player join command. Client should determine whether this command is intended for them to initialize a player state depending on if that client's current id is -1. Ultimately, all final information is determined by the server in case of a malfunctioning or malicious client.

      This command is comprised of the following components:

      color Command Payload
      Key Commentary
      opcode Identifies this command, always join.
      id The UID of the new player.
      x The x position of the new player.
      y The y position of the new player.
      level The number of the level currently being played on.
      Parameters:
      playerId - the UID of the new player.
      x - the x position of the new player.
      y - the y position of the new player.
      levelId - the integer representing the current level being played on.
      Returns:
      the command payload.

    • cmdLeave

      public static Map<String,String> cmdLeave(int playerId)
      Generates the payload for a player leave command.

      This command is comprised of the following components:

      color Command Payload
      Key Commentary
      opcode Identifies this command, always leave.
      id The UID of the new player.
      Parameters:
      playerId - the UID of the departing player.
      Returns:
      the command payload.

    • cmdDamaged

      public static Map<String,String> cmdDamaged(int playerId, int dmg)
      Generates the payload for a player damaged command.

      This command is comprised of the following components:

      color Command Payload
      Key Commentary
      opcode Identifies this command, always leave.
      id The UID of the hit player.
      dmg The integer amount of damage dealt.
      Parameters:
      playerId - the UID of the hit player.
      dmg - the amount of damage dealt.
      Returns:
      the command payload.

    • cmdReset

      public static Map<String,String> cmdReset(int playerId, double x, double y)
      Generates the payload for a player reset command.

      This command is comprised of the following components:

      color Command Payload
      Key Commentary
      opcode Identifies this command, always reset.
      id The UID of the player that is being reset.
      x The new x position of the reset player.
      y The new y position of the reset player.
      Parameters:
      playerId - the UID of the hit player.
      x - the new x position of the player.
      y - the new y position of the player.
      Returns:
      the command payload.

    • cmdBuy

      public static Map<String,String> cmdBuy(Item item, int playerId)
      Generates the payload for a shop purchase command.

      This command is comprised of the following components:

      color Command Payload
      Key Commentary
      opcode Identifies this command, always buy.
      item The string type of the item being purchased.
      id The UID of the player that bought the item. This field is ignored for client to server communication, but is used when the server broadcasts the new item to all other clients.
      Parameters:
      item - the item purchased.
      playerId - the UID of the player buying the item.
      Returns:
      the command payload.

    • cmdPay

      public static Map<String,String> cmdPay(int money, int playerId)
      Generates the payload for a player payment command.

      This command is comprised of the following components:

      color Command Payload
      Key Commentary
      opcode Identifies this command, always pay.
      money The amount of money given to the player.
      id The UID of the player.
      Parameters:
      money - the amount of money given to the player.
      playerId - the UID of the player.
      Returns:
      the command payload.

    • cmdUse

      public static Map<String,String> cmdUse(int itemNum, int playerId)
      Generates the payload for an item usage command.

      This command is comprised of the following components:

      color Command Payload
      Key Commentary
      opcode Identifies this command, always use.
      item_num The number of the item being used.
      id The UID of the player using the item.
      Parameters:
      itemNum - the number key of the item being used.
      playerId - the UID of the player using the item.
      Returns:
      the command payload.

    • serialize

      public static String serialize(Map<String,String> map)
      Serializes a Map to a String. The keys and values of the map are permitted to contain any character that can be successfully passed over a network socket. Commas, colons, and double-quotes are allowed and will be managed accordingly by the deserialize method.

      This method does not rely on the Map.toString method. The syntax of the returned string is as follows:

      • The string begins and ends with curly brackets
      • All keys and values, which must be strings, are enclosed within literal double-quotes
      • Any double-quotes already present in the keys and values are converted to the literal string '\"' (that is, the value \\\\\" is inserted to replace any \")
      • Keys are separated from values with a single colon, and without any whitespace
      • Map entries are separated with a single comma, and without any whitespace

      An example string for the map {key=value, ke"y=value}, when printed to the standard output, would be:

      '{"key":"value","ke\"y"="value"}'

      Parameters:
      map - the Map to serialize.
      Returns:
      the serialized string.
      See Also:
      • deserialize(java.lang.String)

    • deserialize

      public static Map<String,String> deserialize(String str)
      Deserializes a Map from a String.
      Parameters:
      str - the string to deserialize.
      Returns:
      the deserialized map.
      See Also:
      • serialize(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>)
